Drama, guest starring Anita Dobson and Karl Howman, with Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: Bafta award-winning writer Sandy Welch's dramatisation of Jane Austen's novel, first published in 1815. Romola Garai stars as the independent Emma Woodhouse, who believes she is a skilled matchmaker and tries to pair up her friends and acquaintances. She takes Harriet Smith under her wing and encourages the woman to set her sights higher than her current suitor - against Mr Knightley's warnings about the dangers of meddling. With Jonny Lee Miller, Michael Gambon, Jodhi May and Tamsin Greig

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: While continuing her efforts to set up Harriet and the vicar, Emma looks forward to meeting Frank Churchill at the Christmas party, but when he fails to show up she becomes the subject of Mr Elton's unwanted attention. Later, village gossip focuses on the arrival of Jane Fairfax and a piano she was given by a mystery admirer, leaving the matchmaker reluctant to believe Mr Knightley could have sent the gift. Drama, starring Romola Garai, Louise Dylan, Blake Ritson and Laura Pyper

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: The heroine plans a ball with Frank, and wonders whether she has feelings for him. Despite having a wonderful time at the event, she still feels trapped, and with the matchmaking effort officially abandoned, becomes increasingly bored. However, her spirits are raised by Mr Knightley's proposal for a group outing to Box Hill, where he tells her he thinks Frank and Jane are in love. Drama, starring Romola Garai and Michael Gambon

programme.title: Emma
programme.desc: The outing to Box Hill ends in disaster when Emma insults Miss Bates. After being berated by Knightley, she realises her behaviour was shameful and tries to make amends, but Jane refuses to speak to her. When Frank's overbearing aunt dies, the Westons expect him to propose to Emma, but his subsequent actions start a chain of events that shocks the heroine, resulting in the realisation of a truth she previously dismissed. Romola Garai and Jonny Lee Miller star in Sandy Welch's dramatisation of Jane Austen's novel

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: It's 1969 and six months since the shootings in Durham Cathedral, and while Gently is almost back to full fitness, Bacchus has lost his confidence and tenders his resignation. Gently is determined to help his sergeant, so he gets him involved in one last case, the death in custody of a man arrested during a street protest - an investigation that leaves both detectives questioning what it means to be a police officer at a time when attitudes to the force are changing. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Lisa McGrillis, Steve Evets and Ruth Gemmell

programme.title: That Day We Sang
programme.desc: The members of a children's choir are reunited in 1969 for a TV documentary, 40 years after a historic recording at the Manchester Free Trade Hall. Middle-aged insurance salesman Tubby is on his own following the death of his mother, but he gets a glimpse of the boy he once was - and the man he could still be - after hearing the record for the first time in decades. At the same time, his fellow ex-chorister Enid lives in a safe world of her own construction, but as the music stirs powerful memories in both of them, dare they make a last grab for love? Imelda Staunton and Michael Ball star in this musical drama inspired by a true story, written and directed by Victoria Wood, with Conleth Hill, Lyndsey Marshal and Daniel Rigby

However, Trump recovered to win the final two frames of the contest and prevail 17-16

Taking part this time around are Judy Murray, Rickie Haywood-Williams, Shaparak Khorsandi, Rob Beckett, Ellie Taylor and Peter Andre

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Stevie suffers a crisis of confidence after losing two patients in a row early in a shift, and begins to fear that Marcus had been right to doubt her clinical skills. Gethin comes to the aid of a drowning boy, which forces him to make a confession about how he is coping with his diagnosis. Donna needs Dylan's advice, and a new paramedic makes amends for some poor decisions

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan confronts Andreas about the incriminating photograph that has been e-mailed to her. In Saxby-on-Avon, Atticus Pünd assists Inspector Chubb in the investigation of the murders of Mary Blakiston and Magnus Pye by suggesting that police divers search the lake

programme.title: Match of the Day

Brighton and Brentford will have their sights set on securing European football next season, while Palace had enjoyed an improvement in form under returning manager Roy Hodgson, and Wolves, West Ham and Forest are among a number of teams battling against relegation

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer count down the Premier League's most memorable celebrations

programme.title: Greta (2018)
programme.desc: Waitress Frances McCullen gets more than she bargained for when she finds a handbag on a New York train and returns it to a grateful Greta Hideg. The bag's owner is a lonely widow who hides her dark and sinister plan for Frances behind maternal charm. Neil Jordan's thriller, starring Isabelle Huppert, Chloe Grace Moretz and Maika Monroe

Brighton and Brentford will have their sights set on securing European football next season, while Palace had enjoyed an improvement in form under returning manager Roy Hodgson, and Wolves, West Ham and Forest are among a number of teams battling against relegation

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Highgrove House ahead of the Coronation, and reflects on how the gardens are a testament to King Charles' lifelong desire to champion environmental causes. Gyles Brandreth recalls important events that have shaped the life and faith of King Charles and discusses the pioneering work of The Prince's Trust. The Dean of Westminster reveals the preparations for the upcoming ceremony and about the sacred symbols used in Coronations

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Chris Bavin is on hand to make the rural English dream a reality by presenting some beautiful properties to a couple returning to the UK after 20 years living abroad in Canada. They have a big budget to spend on a new home and are open to the countryside in either Worcestershire or Warwickshire

programme.title: Moana (2016)
programme.desc: A brave Polynesian teenager has been raised by her father to be the chief of her people, but longs to leave their island home for a life as an explorer. To save her people from a terrible curse, she sets sail in search of a legendary magical hero, and persuade him to set things right by returning a goddess' stolen heart. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the most spectacular footage from the series, capturing wildlife from around the world on film using the latest camera technology, and revealing how they adapt to overcome the challenges posed by living in jungles, mountains, deserts, islands, grasslands and cities

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith visits a farm in the Outer Hebrides during lambing season, while Paralympic athlete Sammi Kinghorn pays a visit to her family farm in the Scottish Borders, reflecting on how growing up here created a lifelong love of animals, but was also where she had the accident that caused her paralysis. Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Alan Shearer and Gary Cahill to review the day's Premier League action, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield. The Citizens faced a test of their title credentials against a Fulham side that have impressed this season. Liverpool claimed a 2-1 win over Spurs in the reverse fixture, but the Londoners looked to have the better chance of finishing in the top four. Plus, Bournemouth v Leeds United, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Newcastle United v Southampton

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest games in the Super League, including Aston Villa v Manchester United and Manchester City v Reading

programme.title: Beatriz at Dinner (2017)
programme.desc: A holistic medicine practitioner visits a wealthy client at home, only to find herself stranded when her car breaks down. The client invites her to attend a dinner party she is throwing that night, where she is drawn into a battle of wills with her privileged fellow guests. Comedy drama, starring Salma Hayek and John Lithgow

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The team investigates long covid and the criminals cashing in on it with the help of consultant Joanna Herman who suffers from it herself. Plus, an exploration into the dangerous side effects of some common acne medications. Dr Xand examines the latest social media trend in which people tape their mouths closed while asleep to help with breathing, snoring and bad breath

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A one-bedroom flat in Hackney, central London, a semi in Stoke-on-Trent and a cottage with huge potential in a village just outside Bath are sold at online property auctions. Once renovated, the developers who bought them all hope to turn a profit on their investments. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gets to work on his veg plot and plants his first lot of potatoes. Joe Swift meets a garden designer who faced the challenge of two awkward, adjoining plots and transformed them into wonderful, cohesive spaces. Plus, Rekha Mistry demonstrates how to grow the perfect onion from seed, and has a go at growing cotton

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second session of the opening semi-final. Mark Williams and Judd Trump won four frames apiece in last year's corresponding session, but the dominance of 'The Juddernaut' in the morning meant he went held a comfortable-looking 11-5 lead

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield featuring session two of the second semi-final. Ronnie O'Sullivan moved into a 10-6 lead over John Higgins at this stage last year, fighting back from 51 points behind with 51 remaining in the final frame of the session to put himself into a strong position going into Saturday's play

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor test their general knowledge skills and keep their eyes on the prize before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Ellie Simmonds won the nation's hearts competing for Team GB during four Paralympic games. She might have recently retired from swimming, but still has a special connection to the water. After she checks into the 19th-century Victorian villa, Sharon and the team take her on a whistle-stop tour of Northern Ireland's Causeway coast. During her stay, she sets sail on the Atlantic Ocean, discovering all the coastline has to offer, including the site of former Kinbane Castle. Ellie also visits a potato farm with a spectacular view and gets down and dirty digging for some spuds

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the third session of the opening semi-final. Mark Williams enjoyed his strongest session of his match against Judd Trump at this stage last year, winning six of eight frames to reduce his opponent's lead to 13-11 and receiving a standing ovation. However, it was ultimately 'the Juddernaut' who progressed to the final

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the Dry Garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol Klein reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. With a ban on peat in compost on the way, Arit Anderson investigates what that means for the industry and gardeners alike

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: Philomena reaches the end of her historical journey, and finds herself in Brexit Britain. Comedy documentary, starring Diane Morgan, with guests Howard Goodall, Mark Lawson, Neil Oliver and Robert Peston

programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America
programme.desc: Actor David Harewood travels across the US to discover the stories behind his artistic heroes from the 1960s to the 1990s. Along the way he discovers how these African-American performers, film-makers and writers have come to transform popular culture around the world

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers work in pairs to transform three independent shops in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, on a budget of £3,000 in just two days. Ry and Jack struggle to relate to the clientele of the shoe shop they're designing and Alan wonders if Ry has lost his mojo. Tom and Temi are paired together to transform the Sheepskin shop, but a disagreement over colour schemes could derail their design before it has even been made. Monika and Peter get to work on a minimalist but functional scheme for a fashion store but Monika worries she has bitten off more than she can chew

programme.desc: The team shows how to make the final part of the Tardis

programme.title: Deadly Predators
programme.desc: Steve Backshall goes in search of powerful predators, including a sea eagle that is an expert at lifting fish up to one third of its bodyweight out of the water

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 15 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the third and penultimate session of the second semi-final

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott serves up a seafood special and his catches of the day include a fish pie from Mary Berry, a crab and leek tart from the Hairy Bikers, Nigel Slater's mackerel and bacon salad, a lobster dish from James Martin and Lorraine Pascale's fish and chips

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 1.00pm). Coverage of the opening match in the fifth and final round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. These were the top two teams last year, with England securing the Grand Slam after a 24-12 victory in Bayonne, and this fixture could decide the destination of the championship once again

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Weasels are often portrayed as villains and associated with bad behaviour. In an attempt to determine whether that assessment is correct, this documentary employs the use of over 50 hidden cameras to follow the adventures of first-time stoat mum Bandita as she raises her kits in a unique weasel wonderland. Cameras capture the creatures interacting, revealing the true nature of the weasel family - feisty and fearless. Narrated by Julie Walters

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: As one of the most dramatic tournaments of recent years continues, there is further coverage of day 15 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the fourth and concluding session of the opening semi-final

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Members of the public gather at the Imperial War Museum Duxford in Cambridgeshire to present their antiques to James Lewis and Christina Trevanion. Among the items are an enormous Chinese ceramic foot bath and three pendants. Paul Martin also visits the exquisite rooms of Audley End, a local stately home

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Five years ago, Gregg Wallace visited a North Yorkshire food factory to find out how they made their popular sausages. Now he is back to learn the secret of the vegan variety, and discovers the process is surprisingly space age. Cherry Healey learns how Canadian soybeans are transformed into protein-packed tofu and historian Ruth Goodman uncovers the green shoots of the vegetarian movement in Britain

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 15 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the fourth and concluding session of the second semi-final. Last year's corresponding session lasted just four frames before Ronnie O'Sullivan had wrapped up a 17-11 victory over John Higgins, and 'the Rocket' went on to win the title, becoming the oldest ever winner of the prestigious title at the age of 46. He went into this event among the favourites once again, but a number of players in this half of the draw, including Mark Selby, Higgins and Mark Allen will also have hoped to be in contention. O'Sullivan has broken many records in the sport during his illustrious career, and this year's tournament saw him claim another one, as he surpassed Steve Davis' record for most crucible appearances

programme.title: Glastonbury 2010
programme.desc: The American country star's 2010 appearance on the Pyramid Stage at the music and arts festival. Presented by Mark Radcliffe

programme.title: James Brown at the Electric Proms
programme.desc: The Godfather of Soul's 2006 performance as part of the inaugural event at the Roundhouse in the London borough of Camden. Featuring a showcase of jazz standards and classic tracks, with a 24-piece band and the London Community Gospel Choir joining Brown in one of his final performances

programme.title: Apocalypse Now: Final Cut (1979)
programme.desc: An army captain is sent on a top-secret mission into Cambodia, where his goal is to find and assassinate a renegade colonel who has gone insane and is worshipped by his followers as a god. However, as his patrol boat journeys further upriver, the conflict and disarray surrounding him becomes increasingly disturbing and nightmarish. Extended version of Francis Ford Coppola's acclaimed Vietnam War drama - re-edited in 2019 by the director himself to mark the film's 40th anniversary. Starring Martin Sheen, Marlon Brando and Robert Duvall

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Gordon sends Ashley a photo that was not meant for her and in an attempt to delete it before she sees it he chases her all over town, from a garage sale to a death bed. Australian comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the Dry Garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol Klein reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. With a ban on peat in compost on the way, Arit Anderson investigates what that means for the industry and gardeners alike

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charles III has long been a champion of the countryside, so Charlotte Smith and Hamza Yassin travel to Dumfries House, a showcase for His Majesty's passion for rural life. Charlotte meets schoolchildren at the estate's education farm and garden to find out about the King's ambition to create the next generation of nature-loving food producers, and his mission to reinvigorate traditional crafts. Hamza discovers how the 2,000-acre estate has been transformed to help wildlife, and welcomes the newest residents to the walled garden - hedgehogs

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The main potato crop goes in the ground, ready for harvesting later in the year, while Carole Baxter plants yellow rattle plugs in the lawn, which is a great plant to help encourage wildflowers as it inhibits the growth of grass and helps other species develop. Calum Clunie hast the latest developments at his allotment in Leven in Fife, and Kirsty Wilson has another in her series on house plant care

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond walks north along the John o' Groats Trail, along the way meeting the man who created the route and finding out how it was inspired by the Appalachian Trail in Virginia. Rosie Morton is in Easter Ross to investigate how drones are being used to calculate how much carbon is locked away in farmland, and Arlene Stuart tests the responses of the Galloway Mountain Rescue team in a fast-water emergency scenario

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway is in Pembrokeshire, admiring its majestic cliffs constantly pounded by roaring waves. He really feels what it's like to be exposed to the elements as the skies open and it pours down. However, the inclement weather fails to prevent his trek from Abereiddy to Whitesands from proceeding. En route, the presenter peeks at some seal pups, learns how to train a sheepdog and builds a stone wall. He also helps to create a unique sand circle

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge is joined by Hairy Bikers duo Si King and Dave Myers and challenges them to come up with a speedy meal to rival his quick sausage and bean casserole, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack surprises them all with his choice of wine to match the food. Plus, Fast Show star Arabella Weir goes behind the scenes at one of London's most upmarket hotels to discover the secret to making the perfect sandwich

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts as the remaining three contestants take part in the final as they compete to be crowned the first-ever winner of the competition, with the cooks having to impress Mary Berry, Angela Hartnett and Chris Bavin if they're to win the title. First, the competitors take on the Rustle Up challenge, creating dishes that showcase butternut squash as the main ingredient, before being asked to produce their ultimate picnic and presenting their creations to the judges at a beautifully decorated picnic tables. Who will be crowned the winner?

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the opening session of the final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where eight frames take place. Ronnie O'Sullivan and Judd Trump met in last year's final and O'Sullivan raced into an early lead, though Trump did fight back to win the last two frames of the opening session to leave the match finely poised at 5-3 going into the evening session

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team examine antiques at Ashridge House, Hertfordshire. Thomas Plant discovers a marble cupid statue while a 19th-century brass microscope with an extensive collection of botanical slides catches the eye of Claire Rawle. Plus, the presenter takes time out to explore art at the Henry Moore Foundation in Much Hadham, which houses the largest collection of Moore's work

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The two finalists are challenged to make over two pubs in a busy tourist hotspot in Brighton. One designer will be transforming an award-winning gastro pub with a field to fork ethos, while the other competitor is tasked with turning a traditional pub into a fun day-to-night venue aimed at a younger clientele. Once the challenge is compete, the pair head back to the design studio where they are cross examined by Alan and the judges. Who will be crowned this year's winner?

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the second session of the final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where nine frames take place. Ronnie O'Sullivan enjoyed a strong session at this stage of the 2022 tournament against Judd Trump, winning all but two of the frames to extend his lead to 12-5, the largest advantage he had held in any of the world finals he had played after the first day. His 118 break in the 11th frame was his 15th century of the tournament, a new personal best in a single year at the Crucible

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel game, with Ria Lina, Eshaan Akbar and Jimmy Carr joining regular Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of tricks and treats

programme.title: The Wife (2017)
programme.desc: Successful writer Joe Castleman is delighted to receive an early morning telephone call from Sweden informing him that he has won this year's Nobel Prize in Literature. His steadfast wife Joan is equally delighted, but as she prepares to travel to Stockholm to support and encourage her husband, she reflects on her life from when she first met Joe, her married literature tutor with whom she embarks on the affair which would change the course of their lives. Oscar-nominated drama, starring Glenn Close, Jonathan Pryce and Max Irons

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr Lagerfeld
programme.desc: Award-winning director Michael Waldman goes in search of the real Karl Lagerfeld, who was one of the most flamboyant and recognisable figures in fashion, but also one of the most mysterious. Waldman tracks down those closest to the designer, including his friends, neighbour, lawyer, doctor, bodyguard and Chanel colleagues. He also meets the agent and nanny left in charge of Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, who he called the love of his life and who earned an estimated three million euros from modelling assignments

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Greenford, west London, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough introduces the colourful underwater world of Britain and Ireland's oceans, including thousands of grey seals congregating on the Norfolk shoreline to give birth. Rich beds of sea grass act as important carbon storage areas, as well as providing home for seahorses, while on the shallow seabed, the spider crab undergoes a mass migration of epic scale

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from August 8, 1994, featuring music by Maxx, Level 42, Ce Ce Peniston, Status Quo, Rozalla, Whitesnake, PJ and Duncan, Youssou N'dour with Neneh Cherry and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo presents music by Brand New Heavies, Future Sound of London, Shampoo, DJ Miko, Joe Cocker, Carleen Anderson, Let Loose and Wet Wet Wet in an edition originally broadcast on August 10, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read and Gary Davies present the chart programme, first broadcast on April 25 1985, featuring Bronski Beat and Marc Almond, Phil Collins, New Model Army, DeBarge, Eurythmics, Freddie Mercury, David Grant and Jaki Graham and USA for Africa

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the third session of the opening semi-final. Mark Williams enjoyed his strongest session of his match against Judd Trump at this stage last year, winning six of eight frames to reduce his opponent's lead to 13-11 and receiving a standing ovation. However, it was ultimately 'the Juddernaut' who progressed to the final

programme.title: Totally 60s Psychedelic Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the genre from programmes such as Colour Me Pop, How It Is, Top of the Pops and Once More with Felix. Performers include Status Quo, the Incredible String Band, Donovan, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band, Julie Driscoll with Brian Auger and the Trinity, the Moody Blues, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Joe Cocker, the Move, Procol Harum, Cream, Jimi Hendrix and the Who

programme.title: Zappa (2020)
programme.desc: The first all-access documentary - years in the making - about Frank Zappa. It conveys the scope of his prodigious and varied creative output, and the breadth of his extraordinary personal and political life. The documentary team was granted exclusive access by Gail Zappa to a vast collection of Zappa's unreleased music, movies, incomplete projects, unseen interviews and unheard concert recordings. Much of these were deteriorating and in danger of being lost for ever

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The former Monty Python star's expedition takes him to Senegal, where he witnesses a wrestling competition, visits jazz clubs, and meets soap star Marie-Madeleine. He also visits Bamako and Dogon country, then travels to Djenne, where he celebrates the Muslim Tabaski feast and secures a passage on a cargo boat to take him down the Niger River to Timbuktu

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The intrepid traveller embarks on a trip from the Khyber Pass to the Bay of Bengal, an arduous journey through Pakistan's mountains, India, Nepal, China and finally Bangladesh. The adventure begins on the Khyber steam railway, taking in Darra, where he browses for a unique firearm. He then heads toward Chitral to watch a freestyle polo grudge-match take place on the highest polo field in the world

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc: A dashing British hero suffers a conflict of loyalties on learning of the German plan to start the First World War a year early - on the same day as his annual Cornish fishing holiday. He elects not to either sacrifice his much-needed break but soon runs into an even more dastardly plot. Comedy, starring Michael Palin

programme.title: Peter Sellers: A State of Comic Ecstasy
programme.desc: The comedy pioneer behind The Goon Show, Dr Strangelove and the Pink Panther series is explored in depth in this film surveying his meteoric rise to fame and troubled personal life. The film charts his formative years backstage as part of his parents' itinerant music hall revue group, his years of wartime service in India and Burma, through to his global superstardom. His two surviving children Sarah and Victoria recall the challenges of growing up alongside his mood swings, while his grandson Will explores the troubled legacy his grandfather left behind

programme.title: Dawn Chorus: The Sounds of Spring

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monster’s small kite doesn’t seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Mack’s Stall. She chooses a bag of chick feed and remembers the day she got it. A yawning Bob asks Mack to help him get something very important over to his stall without Moira spotting him. Bob sneaks a big box into his shed and shows Mack what’s inside – a bunch of tiny, fluffy chicks! Bob is exhausted – they’ve been keeping him up half the night – but he doesn’t want to leave his babies home alone. Although Bob’s babies are very cute, they’re also very noisy. It won’t be long before Moira hears them, and there are no pets allowed in the Big Hub. Mack and Bob need to find a way to keep the fluffy chicks quiet before Moira finds out. Bob manages to stop Moira hearing the chicks for a while with help from Mack, Daisy, Molly and Suki, but it isn’t long before the game is up.

programme.title: Colourblocks

programme.title: Biff and Chip
programme.desc: As Dad arrives home with a mystery package, he finds himself set upon by three pirates: Biff, Chip and Kipper. They have their eyes set on the large box packaging, which they think will be perfect to make their very own pirate ship in the garden. But, as their piratical creation takes shape, Wilf and Wilma spy on them from next door and are quickly inspired to make their own pirate ship too. On either side of the fence, the children’s swashbuckling creations soon become larger and more colourful as they each compete to see whose ship will be the best.

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Micheal wants to find out all about devil's coach horse beetles in today’s episode. Chantelle meets some schoolchildren, and they look for a devil’s coach horse beetle in their fantastic nature garden, whilst Rory heads into the woods to meet a beetle expert. Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help explain all of Micheal's questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem, we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, devil's coach horse beetles are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Chantelle and the children put their noses to the test with a supersmelly challenge!

She and her owner, Katrina, visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. Sylvie and Katrina visit a school to help a little boy called Leo overcome his stage fright so he can perform his magic trick at show and tell. Leo really wants to take part, but he’s feeling shy and needs Sylvie’s help. Sylvie uses her superheart to help Leo feel brave enough to rehearse his trick with her – she can be his furry assistant! Then she pretends to be a furry table for Leo and his friends so they can make amazing decorations for the stage. And then – it’s showtime. Will Sylvie’s superheart help Leo overcome his nerves so they can perform his amazing cup-and-ball trick and take a bow-wow-wow?

programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Highgrove House ahead of the Coronation, and reflects on how the gardens are a testament to King Charles' lifelong desire to champion environmental causes. The Dean of Westminster reveals the preparations for the upcoming ceremony and about the sacred symbols used in Coronations

To save her people from a terrible curse, she sets sail in search of a legendary magical hero, and persuade him to set things right by returning a goddess' stolen heart. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Weatherman Walking

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores north-east Wales, beginning his journey on a moor near Llangollen to see hen harriers, one of the UK's most threatened birds of prey. He also visits a nature reserve on a bog, discovers the wildlife that has colonised Marford Quarry, and ends his journey on the Dee Estuary, where he sees thousands of wading birds near Point of Ayr

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Arleen, the daughter of a Holocaust survivor, thanks Chris, the man whose grandparents hid her mother to save her life. Alex Jones also meets ex-soldier Nathan, who was sent to Belfast for his first operational tour at 18. His behaviour took a downward spiral, including what he recalls as causing trouble for his commanding officer, so he seeks forgiveness from his former platoon officer

Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Alan Shearer and Gary Cahill to review the day's Premier League action, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield. The Citizens faced a test of their title credentials against a Fulham side that have impressed this season. Liverpool claimed a 2-1 win over Spurs in the reverse fixture, but the Londoners looked to have the better chance of finishing in the top four. Plus, Bournemouth v Leeds United, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Newcastle United v Southampton

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest games in the Super League, including Aston Villa v Manchester United and Manchester City v Reading

programme.title: Beatriz at Dinner (2017)
programme.desc: A holistic medicine practitioner visits a wealthy client at home, only to find herself stranded when her car breaks down. The client invites her to attend a dinner party she is throwing that night, where she is drawn into a battle of wills with her privileged fellow guests. Comedy drama, starring Salma Hayek and John Lithgow

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The woman who raised thousands of pounds for her best friend's cancer treatment, only to find out the diagnosis was a lie. Plus, Dr Xand and co-host Ashley John-Baptiste reveal whether 10,000 steps really is a magic number when it comes to staying healthy

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a woman who has collapsed in the heat, and 999 call handlers deal with a patient having a heart attack while on the phone

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A one-bedroom flat in Hackney, central London, a semi in Stoke-on-Trent and a cottage with huge potential in a village just outside Bath are sold at online property auctions. Once renovated, the developers who bought them all hope to turn a profit on their investments. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Christina Trevanion and experts Catherine Southon and Kate Bliss go antique hunting in Peterborough, Cambridgeshire, before heading to Lichfield in Staffordshire for today's auction. Christina discovers the history of the humble jigsaw and takes a closer look at a huge collection of puzzles

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Marlene is unable to investigate a racing pigeon theft, as she is allergic to birds. Al and Callum discover that the owner may be better off without his feathered friends due to a rare medical condition that could kill him. Finn tells Siobhan that he's decided to move out of the family home, so she turns her attentions to Port Devine's most eligible bachelor. Niamh catches her father drinking while working

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Retired couple Steven and Sue love their two-bedroom bungalow, but Steven's mobility issues have left Sue taking on more of the workload, and their tired, cluttered shed does not help matters. The team sets out to turn the shed into a practical and welcoming space for Sue to do her volunteer work, and make it easier for Steven to access his mobility scooter

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: In the Cotswolds, Nicki Chapman and a couple from Scotland don't need to look too far to find the characterful cottage of their dreams for a £600,000 budget. While in the locality, Nicki drops in on showjumping legend and double Olympic gold medallist Nick Skelton, along with his sons Harry and Dan, who are following in their father's 'hoof' prints

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers bid against each other on a plate with a famous name on it, a light from an operating theatre, a puzzle box and some Chinese silver - as well as a quirky orange item

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Rose Matafeo joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jena rounds off the working week with the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond walks north along the John o' Groats Trail, along the way meeting the man who created the route and finding out how it was inspired by the Appalachian Trail in Virginia. Rosie Morton is in Easter Ross to investigate how drones are being used to calculate how much carbon is locked away in farmland, and Arlene Stuart tests the responses of the Galloway Mountain Rescue team in a fast-water emergency scenario

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League defender Curtis Davies, Olympic 4x100m relay champion Mark Lewis-Francis, England cricketer Alex Hartley and Tokyo Games BMX gold medallist Bethany Shriever join team captains Sam Quek and Ugo Monye and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The third quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2019 champion Irini Tzortzoglou, 2021 champion Tom Rhodes and 2018 semi-finalist Nisha Parmar

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade hosts as journalist Stacey Dooley and comedian Phil Wang join in the fun on the satirical current affairs quiz, alongside regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: A gamekeeper is murdered in rural Wales, and it falls to Wicky to clean up the mess. However, Wicky and the undertakers aren't the only people at the scene of the crime - and things soon take an even more sinister turn. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Joshua McCord and Zita Sattar

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Martian (2015)
programme.desc: A manned mission to Mars is abruptly abandoned, with one crew member left for dead. However, the astronaut has survived and faces a series of challenges - to contact Earth and arrange his rescue and to survive for the years it will take for a spacecraft to reach him on resources intended to last the crew a month. Ridley Scott's sci-fi drama based on the novel by Andy Weir, starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting the ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Tom Parker-Bowles and Lara Lee, plus special guest Greg Davies. Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: Kirsty Wilson creates four eco-friendly garden items all from recycled materials, including a fairy garden made out of broken terracotta pots and a terrarium out of a glass teapot

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Falkirk v Inverness Caledonian Thistle (Kick-off 12.15pm). Live coverage of the first Scottish Cup semi-final at Hampden Park, as the Scottish League One and Scottish Championship sides contest a place in the final against either Rangers or Celtic. If the Bairns manage to progress to the final they will do so without having faced any top-flight opposition en route to the showpiece match, whereas Caley Thistle have already dispatched Livingston and Kilmarnock in the fifth round and quarter-finals respectively

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day 15 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the fourth and concluding session of the opening semi-final. Having trailed by some distance in the first half of the match, Mark Williams continued his fightback against Judd Trump in last year's corresponding session, taking the lead for the first time at 16-15. However, Trump recovered to win the final two frames of the contest and prevail 17-16

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland. With analysis from Martin Keown and Dion Dublin

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Olympic swimmer Mark Foster, stand-up comedian Dane Baptiste, BBC film critic Ali Plumb and actor Arabella Weir are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Madness, Scarface, the radio series of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, and Sophie Tucker

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan asks general knowledge questions against the clock as contestants try to avoid being voted off the team

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a revival of the comedy game show, in which a panel of six celebrities fill in the blanks to help contestants win some brilliant prizes. Taking part this time around are Judy Murray, Rickie Haywood-Williams, Shaparak Khorsandi, Rob Beckett, Ellie Taylor and Peter Andre

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a star-studded version of the general knowledge quiz. Sunil Patel, Helen Bauer, George Robinson, Rukku Nahar, Andy Goldstein, Tamzin Outhwaite, Katrina Ridley and Alex Mansuroglu try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Stevie suffers a crisis of confidence after losing two patients in a row early in a shift, and begins to fear that Marcus had been right to doubt her clinical skills. Gethin comes to the aid of a drowning boy, which forces him to make a confession about how he is coping with his diagnosis. Donna needs Dylan's advice, and a new paramedic makes amends for some poor decisions

programme.title: Magpie Murders
programme.desc: Susan confronts Andreas about the incriminating photograph that has been e-mailed to her. In Saxby-on-Avon, Atticus Pünd assists Inspector Chubb in the investigation of the murders of Mary Blakiston and Magnus Pye by suggesting that police divers search the lake

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker is joined by Alan Shearer and Jermaine Jenas to present highlights of the latest Premier League matches, featuring Brighton & Hove Albion v Wolverhampton Wanderers, Crystal Palace v West Ham United at Selhurst Park and Brentford v Nottingham Forest at Gtech Community Stadium. Brighton and Brentford will have their sights set on securing European football next season, while Palace had enjoyed an improvement in form under returning manager Roy Hodgson, and Wolves, West Ham and Forest are among a number of teams battling against relegation

programme.title: Match of the Day Top 10
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Micah Richards and Alan Shearer count down the Premier League's most memorable celebrations

programme.title: Greta (2018)
programme.desc: Waitress Frances McCullen gets more than she bargained for when she finds a handbag on a New York train and returns it to a grateful Greta Hideg. The bag's owner is a lonely widow who hides her dark and sinister plan for Frances behind maternal charm. Neil Jordan's thriller, starring Isabelle Huppert, Chloe Grace Moretz and Maika Monroe

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents the main issues from the world of politics and beyond, featuring interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets a hand-reared cheetah cub, it is time for 20 wallabies to move house, and a pair of baby ring-tailed lemurs are welcomed into the world in the African Village

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development of properties in Havant in Hampshire, Sutton-in-Ashfield in Nottinghamshire and Brighton in East Sussex

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Thomas Forrester and Nick Hall help two teams look for items at Nottingham racecourse, while presenter Charlie tests the fairgoers' knowledge of hallmarks

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Highgrove House ahead of the Coronation, and reflects on how the gardens are a testament to King Charles' lifelong desire to champion environmental causes. Gyles Brandreth recalls important events that have shaped the life and faith of King Charles and discusses the pioneering work of The Prince's Trust. The Dean of Westminster reveals the preparations for the upcoming ceremony and about the sacred symbols used in Coronations

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Chris Bavin is on hand to make the rural English dream a reality by presenting some beautiful properties to a couple returning to the UK after 20 years living abroad in Canada. They have a big budget to spend on a new home and are open to the countryside in either Worcestershire or Warwickshire

programme.title: Moana (2016)
programme.desc: A brave Polynesian teenager has been raised by her father to be the chief of her people, but longs to leave their island home for a life as an explorer. To save her people from a terrible curse, she sets sail in search of a legendary magical hero, and persuade him to set things right by returning a goddess' stolen heart. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Scotland Sings
programme.desc: Part one of two. Vocal coach Yvie Burnett puts together a choir made up of people who lack confidence, have had setbacks or feel socially isolated, training them for performance on stage at the Hydro in Glasgow. Yvie has some tough decisions to make as she must choose who to select solely from video clips and enlists help from both her family and trusted friend Myleene Klass

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith visits a farm in the Outer Hebrides during lambing season, while Paralympic athlete Sammi Kinghorn pays a visit to her family farm in the Scottish Borders, reflecting on how growing up here created a lifelong love of animals, but was also where she had the accident that caused her paralysis. Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the development of properties in Havant in Hampshire, Sutton-in-Ashfield in Nottinghamshire and Brighton in East Sussex

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Thomas Forrester and Nick Hall help two teams look for items at Nottingham racecourse, while presenter Charlie tests the fairgoers' knowledge of hallmarks

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Highgrove House ahead of the Coronation, and reflects on how the gardens are a testament to King Charles' lifelong desire to champion environmental causes. Gyles Brandreth recalls important events that have shaped the life and faith of King Charles and discusses the pioneering work of The Prince's Trust. The Dean of Westminster reveals the preparations for the upcoming ceremony and about the sacred symbols used in Coronations

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Chris Bavin is on hand to make the rural English dream a reality by presenting some beautiful properties to a couple returning to the UK after 20 years living abroad in Canada. They have a big budget to spend on a new home and are open to the countryside in either Worcestershire or Warwickshire

programme.title: Moana (2016)
programme.desc: A brave Polynesian teenager has been raised by her father to be the chief of her people, but longs to leave their island home for a life as an explorer. To save her people from a terrible curse, she sets sail in search of a legendary magical hero, and persuade him to set things right by returning a goddess' stolen heart. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the most spectacular footage from the series, capturing wildlife from around the world on film using the latest camera technology, and revealing how they adapt to overcome the challenges posed by living in jungles, mountains, deserts, islands, grasslands and cities

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith visits a farm in the Outer Hebrides during lambing season, while Paralympic athlete Sammi Kinghorn pays a visit to her family farm in the Scottish Borders, reflecting on how growing up here created a lifelong love of animals, but was also where she had the accident that caused her paralysis. Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Alan Shearer and Gary Cahill to review the day's Premier League action, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield. The Citizens faced a test of their title credentials against a Fulham side that have impressed this season. Liverpool claimed a 2-1 win over Spurs in the reverse fixture, but the Londoners looked to have the better chance of finishing in the top four. Plus, Bournemouth v Leeds United, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Newcastle United v Southampton

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest games in the Super League, including Aston Villa v Manchester United and Manchester City v Reading

programme.title: Beatriz at Dinner (2017)
programme.desc: A holistic medicine practitioner visits a wealthy client at home, only to find herself stranded when her car breaks down. The client invites her to attend a dinner party she is throwing that night, where she is drawn into a battle of wills with her privileged fellow guests. Comedy drama, starring Salma Hayek and John Lithgow

Lloyd suspects foul play, so he compiles a list of suspects and starts following the clues.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.title: Dr No (1962)
programme.desc: James Bond travels to the Caribbean to investigate when a fellow agent is murdered by a trio of mysterious blind assassins. Uncovering evidence of a powerful nuclear-powered weapon being used in Jamaica, Bond joins forces with a CIA operative, a local boat captain and a mysterious beachcomber as he battles a criminal genius with a plan to destoy the US space program. The first in the long-running spy thriller series based on Ian Fleming's novels, starring Sean Connery, Ursula Andress, Jack Lord, Joseph Wiseman, John Kitzmiller and Bernard Lee

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ortis Deley, Maggie Aderin-Pocock, Graeme Hall and Sarah Millican pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Malpractice
programme.desc: As the Medical Investigation Unit continues to examine whether she is fit to practise, Lucinda tries to learn more about why her patient died. She must balance her search for answers with the everyday reality of a busy A&E, hoping to win back the trust of her colleagues. Meanwhile, George and Norma need the co-opration of the doctor's team to help them build a clearer picture of who Lucinda is. Medical thriller, starring Niamh Algar

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Life & Debt: Stories from the Edge
programme.desc: Britain is experiencing the largest fall in living standards since records began almost 70 years ago, with the rising cost of everyday essentials - such as food and household bills - thought to have pushed many into poverty. ITV News' Daniel Hewitt has followed the impact of this crisis for more than a year and examines how it's changed lives across the country. Filmed over the course of the winter, he follows working people battling every day just to stay afloat, shocked by how their circumstances have changed and often unable to see light at the end of the tunnel

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: A pilot requires police help with a very disgruntled passenger, fire engines give a bath to a Boeing 777, and staff from new airline Rwandair have to deal with some very charming travellers

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine.
