Tim Burton's supernatural comedy, starring Michael Keaton, Geena Davis, Alec Baldwin, Winona Ryder, Jeffrey Jones and Catherine O'Hara

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: The Laugh's on Me
programme.desc: The conclusion of the celebration of the actor and comedian as he gives a personal and honest account of his own life, joined by celebrity friends to tell the story of his career. From abandoned pilots and setbacks to his role as Graham on Doctor Who, and the surprise of his record-breaking recording career, this is the life of an incredible entertainer and national treasure

programme.title: ASOS: How Do They Really Do It?
programme.desc: The secrets of the online fashion retailer, with insiders and experts revealing how it has become a global clothes-selling powerhouse in just two decades. The programme uncover how its hi-tech website works and shows how it encourages shoppers to spend and delivers discounts by tracking their preferences, and looks at how the company took on traditional fashion chains and even bought up some of the High Street's biggest brands to become one of the UK's fastest-growing businesses

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Documentary examining how the German supermarket chain became one of Britain's biggest retailers. The programme explores the secrets behind Lidl's famously low prices, with cost-cutting efficiency applied at every stage from warehouse to shop floor. Plus, a look behind the scenes at the award-winning bakery and a glimpse of what the future may hold for a company yet to embrace online shopping

programme.title: Ruby Wax: Cast Away
programme.desc: Part two of two. A tropical storm hits the island on day three of Ruby's isolation and after it clears she is able to forage for much-needed calories in the form of coconuts. As life becomes tougher, Ruby reflects on her own personal traumas growing up, her parents and her own comedy personality that she switches on and off, and what survival means to her

programme.title: Billion Dollar Holiday Resort: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A look at Baha Mar in the Bahamas, a resort that has 11 swimming pools, 40 restaurants and bars, a 100,000 square-foot casino and its own squadron of trained sharks. Perched on a stretch of white-sand beach, this enormous hotel complex can accommodate up to 7,000 people at once, and cameras take a closer look at one of the world's most luxurious resorts

programme.title: Top of the Box
programme.desc: Matthew Kelly takes a look back at the most popular British TV programmes from 1978. Christopher Timothy and Peter Davison recall how All Creatures Great and Small made them famous, Nicholas Parsons reflects on presenting Sale of the Century, Grange Hill star Todd Carty remembers the launch of the long-running children's show, and The Sweeney producer Ted Childs recalls the end of the police drama, and a memorable cameo by Morecambe and Wise

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Sinkholes: Buried Underground
programme.desc: Much of Florida sits on porous rock that is easily eroded and prone to collapse, leading the Sunshine State to be hit by 1,700 sinkholes every year. Cameras reveal what it's like to live in an area where the ground could collapse beneath your feet at any moment

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross pours out his heart to Emily, but is unprepared for her reaction, while Phoebe receives surprising news about her pregnancy. Chandler and Joey get free adult films on their TV and try to make sure they do not disappear

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel's date is ruined when Joshua's parents return home earlier than expected and catch her parading round in a skimpy nightie - which she then has to pretend is a new dress. Starring Jennifer Aniston and Tate Donovan

programme.title: Nick's Quest
programme.desc: Nick Baker highlights the plight of South American Orinoco crocodiles as he documents a conservation project in Venezuela to save the species from extinction. In addition to heading out on a dangerous night-time hunt to find out how the creatures are surviving in the wild, he tries to coax a three-year-old to return to the open river

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mr Zebra delivers a parcel from Aunt Dottie, causing Peppa and George to get excited

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Pip picks Zac to be in his team for the wheelbarrow race and Posy is upset

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: News arrives of an incoming windstorm, but Marshall is being tested for his green belt by Sensei Yumi out in the woods and they cannot be contacted

programme.title: Red Mountain (1951)
programme.desc: A Confederate captain sets out to join forces with notorious guerilla militia Quantrill's Raiders, but stops off en route to rescue a man from being lynched for a murder he himself committed - and complicates matters by falling for his fiancee. Western set during the American Civil War, starring Alan Ladd and Lizabeth Scott

programme.title: Arabian Nights (1942)
programme.desc: The story of two half-brothers - one the heroic caliph, the other an evil usurper - as they do battle for the right to rule their kingdom, and win the hand of beautiful dancer Sherazade. Adaptation of the classic adventure tales, starring Jon Hall, Maria Montez, Sabu and Leif Erickson

programme.title: Dad's Army (1971)
programme.desc: The ragtag soldiers of the Walmington-on-Sea Home Guard are given the chance to prove their mettle by apprehending three German aviators who have parachuted into the country in the vanguard of a suspected Nazi invasion. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, Bill Pertwee, Ian Lavender and Arnold Ridley

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid (1994)
programme.desc: Wise karate mentor Mr Miyagi meets the orphaned teenage grand-daughter of a soldier who once saved his life. As well as guiding her through the trials of high school and her first romance, he takes her to a Zen monastery to hone her martial arts skills. Adventure sequel, starring Pat Morita, Hilary Swank, Michael Ironside and Constance Towers

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Darkman (1990)
programme.desc: A scientist working on synthetic skin is horribly disfigured and left for dead by a criminal gang. Now unable to feel pain, he continues his research, creating artificial faces that will last for only a short time. He uses these disguises to aid him in taking revenge on those who mutilated him - while also using a mask of his own face to see the girlfriend who thinks he died. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson and Frances McDormand

programme.title: Logan (2017)
programme.desc: In the near future, Wolverine cares for an ailing Professor X somewhere on the Mexican border. However, the razor-clawed hero's attempts to hide from the world are turned upside down when a young mutant arrives, pursued by cyborg bounty hunters in the employ of a sinister corporation. Fantasy adventure, starring Hugh Jackman, Patrick Stewart, Dafne Keen and Stephen Merchant. Directed by James Mangold (Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny)

programme.title: The Return of the Living Dead (1985)
programme.desc: A gang of punks battles flesh-eating undead monsters while trapped in a medical supplies warehouse. Director Dan O'Bannon's horror comedy, starring Clu Gulager, Beverly Randolph and James Karen

programme.title: Leap Year (2010)
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott

programme.title: Muppets from Space (1999)
programme.desc: Gonzo hits the road with pal Rizzo in tow and goes in search of his roots - only to make the amazing discovery that his parents belonged to a race of aliens. He then has to choose whether to board a UFO and return to his family, or stay with the friends he knows and loves. Family comedy, with F Murray Abraham, David Arquette, Ray Liotta, Andie MacDowell and Rob Schneider alongside the puppets

programme.title: Playing with Fire (2019)
programme.desc: A straight-laced fire superintendent and his elite team of expert firefighters come to the rescue of three siblings in the path of an encroaching wildfire, but quickly realise that no amount of training could prepare them for their most challenging job yet - as their babysitters. Comedy, starring John Cena, Keegan-Michael Key and John Leguizamo

programme.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock (1984)
programme.desc: Admiral Kirk and his crew hijack the decommissioned Enterprise to recover the body of their fallen comrade Mr Spock from the planet Genesis. Kirk has learnt that Spock's spirit is still alive, and the Vulcan can be resurrected, but he must also battle a Klingon captain determined to control the planet's mysterious energy. Sci-fi sequel, directed by Leonard Nimoy, with William Shatner, DeForest Kelley and Christopher Lloyd

programme.title: Grease (1978)
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody (2018)
programme.desc: Freddie Mercury and Queen go from playing small venues to becoming one of the biggest rock bands in the world. While Freddie comes to terms with his sexuality, outside forces threaten to tear the group apart, until their defining moment at Live Aid in July 1985. Oscar-winning biopic, starring Rami Malek, Lucy Boynton and Gwilym Lee

programme.title: Primal (2019)
programme.desc: A hunter and collector of rare and exotic animals bags a priceless white jaguar for a zoo, but the ship bearing his precious cargo has two predators caged in its hold - the cat, and a political assassin being extradited to the Unites States. After the assassin breaks free - and then frees the jaguar - the hunter feverishly stalks the ship's cramped corridors in hot pursuit of his prey, right up until the unpredictable climax. Action thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Famke Janssen and Kevin Durand

programme.title: Special Delivery (2022)
programme.desc: Eun-ha moonlights from her scrapyard day job as a transporter of unusual items from A to B with no questions asked, but her flawless success record is threatened when she collects a small boy in big trouble. Thriller, starring Park So-dam and Jung Hyeon-jun. In Korean with English subtitles

programme.title: Fantastic Mr Fox (2009)
programme.desc: A rebellious fox decides it is time to grow up and change his chicken-stealing ways for the sake of his wife and children. However, the presence of three wicked farmers near his woodland home proves a challenge he cannot resist. Stop-motion animated adventure based on the novel by Roald Dahl, with the voices of George Clooney, Meryl Streep, Jason Schwartzman and Bill Murray

programme.title: The Adventures of Tintin (2011)
programme.desc: A reporter's purchase of a model ship brings him under threat from a ruthless criminal, as it is one of a series of clues to the location of the real vessel, which holds a pirate's lost treasure. He sets off on a globetrotting quest to find it, assisted by a drunken sea captain, two bumbling detectives and his faithful dog. Steven Spielberg's animated adventure based on Herge's comic-strip series, with the voices of Jamie Bell, Andy Serkis and Daniel Craig

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home (1986)
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew travels back in time to prevent an alien probe destroying the Earth. The only thing that can avert the disaster is a humpback whale, a creature extinct in the 23rd century - but adjusting to life back in 1986 proves a distinct challenge. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring William Shatner, DeForest Kelley and Leonard Nimoy, who also directed

programme.title: The Nanny Diaries (2007)
programme.desc: College graduate Annie takes a job as a nanny to a wealthy family. However, her demanding employers and their spoiled son prove impossible to cope with, and as she falls for a handsome neighbour, she begins to wonder what she really wants out of life. Comedy, starring Scarlett Johansson, Laura Linney and Paul Giamatti

programme.title: Deadpool 2 (2018)
programme.desc: The wisecracking anti-hero meets Russell, a gifted youngster pursued by a heavily armed cyborg from the future. With the aid of fellow mutant Domino and five less lucky teammates, they attempt to defeat the villainous Cable. Action comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Josh Brolin, Julian Dennison and Zazie Beetz

programme.title: Blood Simple (1983)
programme.desc: A man's plot to murder his wife and her lover is ruined by a seedy private eye whose underhand dealings set off a bizarre and horrific chain of events. Downbeat noir thriller from the Coen brothers, starring Frances McDormand, John Getz and M Emmet Walsh

programme.title: The American Friend (1977)
programme.desc: A would-be murderer persuades a neighbour to aid his diabolical plot by convincing his unsuspecting friend he is suffering from a fatal disease and therefore has nothing to lose. Wim Wenders' drama based on Patricia Highsmith's novel Ripley's Game, starring Dennis Hopper and Bruno Ganz

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The McQueens escape room is open for business, but the success is short lived. Meanwhile, Scott is putting all of his effort into getting the Youth Club ready

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The McQueen's are running out of time, DeMarcus is surprised to see Vicky back in the village, and an emotional Peri breaks down

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: After the homestays, the group come together for the final dinner party, where the experts reveal one last task - the Honesty Box, and tensions bubble over for several couples

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj does not want Howard to join him in hosting a show at the planetarium. Sheldon goes to great lengths to ensure Amy is free to help him work on a project

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Luke and Manny prepare for their first school dance, but the rest of the family seems more excited by the occasion. Meanwhile, Mitch and Cameron worry when Lily begins biting other children in the playground. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire becomes a neighbourhood vigilante in the hope of stopping a motorist who has begun speeding through local streets. Jay teaches Manny to ride a bike, before discovering Gloria also needs lessons, while Mitch and Cameron befriend zany stranger Barry. Guest starring James Marsden (X-Men)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Part two of two. Only one fugitive remains on the loose on the streets of Brooklyn after the mass escape of convicts from the prison van and Peralta is forced to enlist a surprising ally in order to apprehend him. Elsewhere, Santiago and Gina attempt to introduce Boyle to proper texting etiquette. Craig Robinson guest stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The cop comedy returns after a mid-season break. When one of the precincts in the area must be closed, an evaluation process takes place. The squad is confident about its assessment - until it turns out the auditor is Santiago's ex-boyfriend Teddy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's ingenious idea for a new smartphone app puts pressure on his friendship with Sheldon, who vies with him for control of the project. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tension mounts when the pals attend a weekend science conference. Howard becomes argumentative after Bernadette runs into a former boyfriend, and the fallout causes chaos with the hotel room arrangements. Rick Fox guest stars, with Simon Helberg and Melissa Rauch

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tries to put a stop to Leonard's plan to be a sperm donor for her ex-boyfriend Zack's wife. Howard, Bernadette, Anu and Raj make the most of the latter's cancelled stag party

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the friends find out that Wil Wheaton is hosting a celebrity game of Dungeons & Dragons at his home, deception and betrayal become the order of the day as they compete to occupy the one open seat at the event. With guest appearance by William Shatner, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Kevin Smith

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell and Cameron seek legal guardians for Lily and begin secretly assessing their family members. The duo's decision is made difficult, however, when they catch Jay dishing out tough love to Manny, and find out that Clare has been taking Luke to a child psychologist due to his lack of development

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire and Gloria hope to spend time with their children outdoors, but their plan backfires. Meanwhile, Phil witnesses an unexpected moment of weakness from Jay. American comedy, starring Julie Bowen, Sofia Vergara and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Peralta and Diaz are framed for a crime they didn't commit, it's up to the other members of the Nine-Nine to find out what really happened and try to save them from going to jail

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Part one of two. Peralta and Diaz adjust to life behind bars, but while Jake is forced to join a prison gang led by notorious inmate Romero, Rosa puts Captain Holt and Sgt Jeffords to the test by making outrageous lists of chores for her

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj after he is forced to move out of his apartment to save money, leading to unexpected conflict among the gang and some unwanted observations from Leonard's mother. Christine Baranski guests

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, but Penny and Raj get along so well together that Leonard starts to feel left out. Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's work and they begin to collaborate on a scientific project

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Penny use Bernadette to spy on Leonard and Priya after the couple invite her and Howard to dinner. An experimental drug helps Raj overcome his fear of talking to women, but proves more effective than he had expected. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard decides to tell his mother that he and Bernadette are engaged - but she later collapses, making him fear the shock of the news has caused her to suffer a heart attack. As the gang convenes at the hospital, Sheldon's fear of infectious diseases lands him in trouble, while Priya and Penny bond over coffee

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The Eurovision party is underway, and Peri, Romeo and Rayne are keen to make sure that Juliet does not miss out on the bank holiday fun

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is stunned when Sheldon announces he is about to go on his first-ever date, and is even more surprised to find herself tagging along. Meanwhile, Leonard and Raj take a trip to the hospital after Howard's new robotic arm creates problems

programme.title: Teen First Dates
programme.desc: Student and would-be paramedic Ella meets fellow Brummie and NHS worker Ryan, while Manchester lad Jake sits down for a meal with model and law student Megan

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence (2016)
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson guides two more singletons on the dating show based naked attraction alone. First into the studio is 26-year-old Adele from Scotland. After beating cancer, Adele wants to live life to the full and find a guy who feels the same. She is followed by 22-year-old Jack from Manchester. After a dramatic four-stone weight-loss, Jack wants to show off his new body and attract the one for him

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 24-year-old beautician Gemma from West Sussex. She has dated a few love rats and is now searching for her Prince Charming. She is followed by 28-year-old bisexual tattoo artist Jennafer, who is fed up of men and now wants to find the perfect woman. Will any of the contestants be just what Jennafer is looking for?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they watched during the final week of February 2017, including Mary Berry Everyday, The Nightly Show, The Secret Life of the Zoo, Little Big Shots, Incredible Medicine, The Secret Chef and the Oscars

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Tattooed teetotaller Danny meets Kate, a mother of one who seems like his perfect match, but it remains to be seen whether they'll get on. Other diners include sharp-tongued anaesthetist David who is paired with rugby-loving marketing manager Alex, and 50-year-old warehouse manager Gary hopes 48-year-old Lancashire lass Wendy will be Ms Right

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
programme.desc: The deck crew try to free a tangled anchor while the guests enjoy paddleboard yoga. Storm realises that he needs to delegate more and decides to appoint a lead deckhand. Natalya grows frustrated over the interior's organisation and is sent over the edge when Natasha and Kyle prioritise service over a tidy pantry

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is stunned when Sheldon announces he is about to go on his first-ever date, and is even more surprised to find herself tagging along. Meanwhile, Leonard and Raj take a trip to the hospital after Howard's new robotic arm creates problems

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Jane Bales makes a power grab at the Ottoman Empire when Murray goes out of town, forcing Beverly to retaliate. Adam is thrilled to learn Dave Kim also plans to go to NYU

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly steps in as PE coach at William Penn Academy, Brea tries to show Adam his mother's good intentions, and Barry and Geoff find themselves up for the same medical internship

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: While gathered around Jay and Gloria's pool on a sunny December day, it dawns on the clan members that they are not going to be together over the festive period, so they bring the holiday forward by organising an 'express Christmas'. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil fears the worst when he misses a call informing him of the results of a routine medical, while Manny's day out with Jay is going well until he is whisked away for a belated birthday treat at the horse races. American comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Lego Masters
programme.desc: The five remaining teams take their construction skills into the great outdoors to complete two challenges on the theme of nature. First they have to create and install a brick display for a nature walk that will be transported to a woodland in Essex. There is also a quickfire round to make as many miniature creatures as they can in 45 minutes, using no more than 15 bricks each. Joining Matthew Ashton as guest judges are comedian Bill Bailey and leading brick artist Sean Kenney. Presented by Melvin Odoom

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Beauty queen and bride-to-be Yasmin has her heart set on a fairy-tale wedding. Powerlifter Yiannis is taking Yasmin's dream to the extreme, but will she be the belle of the ball, or will the nuptials have an ugly twist in the tale?

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Ollie celebrates the publication of his first children's book, while Maeva declines an offer to attend London Fashion Week because Liv and Tristan are there

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Atlanta, Georgia, in an attempt to save a family-run smokehouse restaurant plagued by mismanagement and lazy cooking. Michon's owner, Al Wilson, had always hoped he could pass his beloved business on to daughter Natalie, but when he suffered a collapsed lung the handover came about much earlier than expected. Now it's down to Gordon to motivate Natalie and save Michon's from disaster

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: After eight weeks, the six remaining couples have reached the final Commitment Ceremony following a huge a week that has left a few couples in crisis

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: The experiment enters its final chapter with Homestay Week. While some couples flourish during their visits, others find it difficult to envision a future together

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding present the charity version of the baking show, as TV presenter Emma Willis, radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, Taskmaster co-host Alex Horne and Inbetweeners actor Blake Harrison make their way to the tent. They take on three challenges - decorated biscuits, madeleines in the technical and a showstopping choux sculpture embodying their secret talent, with Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith passing judgement

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is so preoccupied with trying to charm a prospective client that he fails to notice the man's behaviour toward Claire. Meanwhile, problems arise when Jay and Gloria open up their doors to Mitch and Cameron, whose house is being fumigated. American comedy, guest starring Greg Kinnear

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire make Mitch and Cameron a life-changing promise after drinking heavily at a restaurant, and Jay's concerns about Manny and Gloria's relationship are eased when he learns more about their mother-son bond. American comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil struggles to come to terms with the fact Haley is growing up after overhearing a private conversation, and Jay's ego takes a bruising when Mitchell tells the truth about his proudest golf moment. Meanwhile, Gloria discovers Claire's stress-relieving activity. American comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron seizes the opportunity to celebrate his birthday, which only comes around once every four years, so the pressure is on Mitchell to organise an occasion to remember. Phil's day is ruined by the female members of his family, who are all feeling emotional, while Jay tries to assert his manhood when it is called into question. American comedy, starring Eric Stonestreet, Jesse Tyler Ferguson and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron bumps into former clowning partner Lewis at the funeral of his mentor, and the pair decide to resurrect their double-act for a child's birthday party. Meanwhile, Phil employs dirty tactics as he tries to overcome rival real-estate agent Mitzi Roth, and Manny realises his new friend is using him to get close to Gloria - but he is not too bothered about it

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny do their best to divide up all their possessions into two separate households, but tension ensues. Raj and Stuart compete to become indispensable to Howard and Bernadette as the baby's arrival looms. Christopher Lloyd guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's attempts to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home are interrupted by the news that Bernadette has gone into labour. However, it transpires that Howard, Raj and Stuart may have rushed the expectant mother to the hospital too early, with Raj having difficulty keeping the gender of the unborn child a secret

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After spending the holidays apart, the gang get together to hear about Sheldon's and Amy's trip to his mother's, Leonard and Penny recall their Christmas tree adventure, and Howard and Bernadette open up about their first days as parents

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny thinks that Leonard is taking her for granted and has stopped making an effort in their relationship, so she decides to go away for a spa weekend with Amy. Howard and Raj go to extreme lengths to deal with a squeaky floorboard in the baby's bedroom

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tests a newly invented device after hearing that it can help him to read people's emotions. Leonard isn't happy when he finds out that Penny's brother is coming to town so that she can help him to find a job. Raj gathers his ex-girlfriends together so that they can give him some dating advice

programme.title: Shrek (2001)
programme.desc: Anti-social ogre Shrek resolves to stop an evil ruler from banishing fairy-tale characters to his swampland home. However, the reluctant hero ends up forced to rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona from a castle guarded by a dragon, aided only by a wisecracking donkey. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, John Lithgow, Cameron Diaz, Eddie Murphy and Vincent Cassel

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Stranger Things, Hunted, Platinum Party at the Palace, Bargain Hunt, The 1% Club, Spooked Scotland and Celebrity Karaoke Club are appraised by a rolling cast of famous faces including Nick and Liv Grimshaw, Rylan and his mum Linda, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Micah Richards and Jamie Carragher, Martin and Roman Kemp, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aléshé and Mel C and her brother Paul

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Strictly Come Dancing, Vigil, Serengeti II, Come Dine with Me, Ambulance, Hotel Paranormal, Andrew Marr's interview with Keir Starmer, and ITV news coverage of the petrol crisis, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Squid Game, Strictly Come Dancing, The Mating Game, Family Fortunes and Boris Johnson's appearance on The Andrew Marr Show, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Tattooed teetotaller Danny meets Kate, a mother of one who seems like his perfect match, but it remains to be seen whether they'll get on. Other diners include sharp-tongued anaesthetist David who is paired with rugby-loving marketing manager Alex, and 50-year-old warehouse manager Gary hopes 48-year-old Lancashire lass Wendy will be Ms Right

programme.title: Celebrity First Dates
programme.desc: TV presenter Esther Rantzen has found life lonely since the death of her husband Desmond Wilcox in 2000, but is worried her formidable reputation can scare men off. She participates in this celebrity version of the show in which singletons meet up with potential partners at a restaurant. Also appearing on this first edition are actor Richard Blackwood (aka EastEnders bad boy Vincent), The Only Way Is Essex reality TV star Jess Wright and 2012 Paralympics table tennis silver medallist Will Bayley

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Stranger Things, Hunted, Platinum Party at the Palace, Bargain Hunt, The 1% Club, Spooked Scotland and Celebrity Karaoke Club are appraised by a rolling cast of famous faces including Nick and Liv Grimshaw, Rylan and his mum Linda, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Micah Richards and Jamie Carragher, Martin and Roman Kemp, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aléshé and Mel C and her brother Paul

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean
programme.desc: Natasha and Kyle decide to work on their night off to organise the pantry, while divisions in the team begin to deepen as two clear cliques form

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Atlanta, Georgia, in an attempt to save a family-run smokehouse restaurant plagued by mismanagement and lazy cooking. Michon's owner, Al Wilson, had always hoped he could pass his beloved business on to daughter Natalie, but when he suffered a collapsed lung the handover came about much earlier than expected. Now it's down to Gordon to motivate Natalie and save Michon's from disaster

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Philadelphia to help failing Mexican restaurant Zocalo. Owners Greg and Mary Russell met and fell in love while they were working there, and the place held such sentimental importance to them they pooled their money and bought it. Now Gordon tries to turn things around before the floundering business ruins their marriage and tears their family apart

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Maxine is determined to visit Eric in prison, a family feud leaves Romeo with a big choice to make and Goldie comes up with a way to cash in on Eurovision coming to Liverpool

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos on the themes of food and animals

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Tahnee and Ollie go from strength to strength. Meanwhile, one simple question tests the foundation of Evelyn and Rupert's relationship

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: After the homestays, the group come together for the final dinner party, where the experts reveal one last task - the Honesty Box, and tensions bubble over for several couples

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Philadelphia to help failing Mexican restaurant Zocalo. Owners Greg and Mary Russell met and fell in love while they were working there, and the place held such sentimental importance to them they pooled their money and bought it. Now Gordon tries to turn things around before the floundering business ruins their marriage and tears their family apart

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Fremont, California, in an attempt to save a restaurant that is tearing the owners' marriage apart. Saki Kavouniaris took over Spin a Yarn in 1995 and began to turn it into a success, before marrying bartender Jennifer. When the business started to fail, the couple decided to splash out on refurbishments to recover their glory days, but their efforts have been futile and now their relationship is at stake

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to Charlie's Italian bistro in La Verne, southern California, where the owner's lack of business nous is putting her relatives' homes at risk, after her mother and sister put them up as collateral. To make matters worse, the restaurant's food is less than appetising and its long-serving chef seems to be incompetent

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay's next stop is Philadelphia, where family run restaurant Chiarella's is struggling to survive in an area full of thriving Italian eateries. Tommy and Dina Defino's marriage is on the verge of collapse and his sense of personal failure only adds to the troubles of their crisis-ridden business

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is fired for being disrespectful to his boss, and explores new activities in a bid to find a purpose in life other than physics, but Leonard takes drastic action to restore him to his old self. Laurie Metcalf guest stars as Sheldon's mother

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Howard attempt to distract Sheldon with a trip to a historic railway when he slows the progress of their work on the Air Force guidance system. Raj and Stuart look after baby Halley, while Penny and Amy take Bernadette out

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is furious when she learns that Sheldon has shared intimate details of their relationship with his colleagues at the university, prompting their first fight since moving in together. Raj considers trying to live without financial support from his father, who thinks he is spoilt

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Cut off from his father's fortune, Raj struggles to balance his books, so decides to appoint Sheldon to organise his finances and get him out of debt. Penny considers joining the guys at Comic-Con because she thinks Leonard wants her to come along

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldon's old room to Raj after he is forced to move out of his apartment to save money, leading to unexpected conflict among the gang and some unwanted observations from Leonard's mother. Christine Baranski guests

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Penny and Raj settle into their new living arrangement, but Penny and Raj get along so well together that Leonard starts to feel left out. Sheldon expresses an interest in Amy's work and they begin to collaborate on a scientific project

programme.title: Shrek 2 (2004)
programme.desc: The grouchy ogre and his new wife Princess Fiona set out on a journey to meet her parents. However, the king and queen are less than impressed with their daughter's choice of husband, while a conniving fairy godmother is determined to make sure her own son gets to marry the princess. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Mike Myers, Cameron Diaz, Eddie Murphy, Antonio Banderas, John Cleese, Julie Andrews, Jennifer Saunders and Rupert Everett

programme.title: Absolutely Dyer: Danny and Dani Do Italy
programme.desc: Danny and Dani explore Tuscany's art and high culture as they sample a taste of La Dolce Vita on a trip from Florence to Portovenere, known as the 'Bay of Poets'. Danny arranges a trip to see Renaissance masterpieces in the Uffizi Gallery, followed by horse riding and wine tasting at a Tuscan vineyard, before performing poetry to a live audience by the sea at the Cinque Terre

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on The Masked Dancer, Married at First Sight UK, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, Bad Sisters, This Is MY House, Epic Adventures with Bertie Gregory, and ITV News

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection (2016)
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop's arch-enemy Crain kidnaps his new girlfriend Gina and blackmails him into committing three assassinations in as many days, while making them look like accidents. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Jessica Alba, Sam Hazeldine and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match

programme.title: Absolutely Dyer: Danny and Dani Do Italy
programme.desc: Danny and Dani explore Tuscany's art and high culture as they sample a taste of La Dolce Vita on a trip from Florence to Portovenere, known as the 'Bay of Poets'. Danny arranges a trip to see Renaissance masterpieces in the Uffizi Gallery, followed by horse riding and wine tasting at a Tuscan vineyard, before performing poetry to a live audience by the sea at the Cinque Terre

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil is so preoccupied with trying to charm a prospective client that he fails to notice the man's behaviour toward Claire. Meanwhile, problems arise when Jay and Gloria open up their doors to Mitch and Cameron, whose house is being fumigated. American comedy, guest starring Greg Kinnear

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Maxine is determined to visit Eric in prison, a family feud leaves Romeo with a big choice to make and Goldie comes up with a way to cash in on Eurovision coming to Liverpool

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp demonstrates how to create handmade and personalised gifts. She learns about sugarcraft and perfume-making, and also receives a lesson in the art of designing Victorian-style silhouettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Having holidayed many times in Torrox Costa, Spain, house-hunter Judith now feels the time has arrived for her to realise her dream of finding a holiday home in the region. Laura Hamilton pulls out all the stops to show five properties within her budget of £100,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the season draws to a close, the Brits abroad reflect on a strange summer. In Spain, a guest house tries to tempt Spanish visitors with local cuisine and a cycling retreat wins some much-needed business, while a Portuguese holiday village takes delivery of a massive new centrepiece

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien restores an enamel roll-top bath and builds a den out of old doors. Henry Cole makes a wall mounted safe from a jerry can and lovingly restores a cheese-making trough

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Herefordshire and Worcestershire. Henry makes a table from the base of a broken agricultural grain mill, while Simon creates a garden seat from an old mangle

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers investigate a huge case that has them searching far and wide for rightful heirs. They also successfully reunite a family separated by wartime evacuation. Plus, details of unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Wizards Thatch in Alderley Edge, a village in Cheshire. Owners Ian Lambert and his partner Ali Imiolek hope to cast a spell over the competition, but their guests end up picking out problems with the continental breakfast basket

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Blackpool, where James Reay and Simon Dooley run the one-star Winterbourne Hotel and Theatre Showbar. The contestants seem to be relaxed and impressed, but a rival's feedback sends one of the hosts storming out of the room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Perfectionist Andrea Hickmott and her partner Nick Bonner-Williams welcome their guests to Northrise Lodge in Hastings, East Susses, but the rooms are criticised and deemed too clinical to relax in. Andrea also panics when she forgets to put sugar on the tables at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Stephanie and Dominic Parker (who would go on to find fame in Gogglebox) welcome the rest of the contestants to their B&B, the Salutation in Sandwich, Kent. However, an alcohol-fuelled evening of parlour games jeopardises the hosts' chances to win the prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. A wedding proposal appears to be on the cards, and the winner is announced

programme.title: Love It or List It Australia
programme.desc: After travelling the world together, newly-weds Nora and Blair have put down roots in a blonde brick 1960s home in Karrinyup, Perth. They have only been in it for two years, but Blair thinks the problems in the home will not be solved with a renovation. He feels the build is simply too big and he is ready to move. Andrew couldn't agree more and busily researches the west Australia market. Nora on the other hand feels that improvements can be made to the layout of their home and by doing so they will have a great place to raise a family

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer travel to the village of Clifford, West Yorkshire, to meet Vic and Paul Miller, who are unsure whether to sell or upgrade their house. Vic feels that the pair should look for a new home more suitable for them and their two young twins, but Paul believes they could use the budget to transform the property's layout and create a more functional family space

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: When Erin and JB can't fix the doors back onto their solarium, Dick Strawbridge steps in to help them find a solution to their rusted hinges. Another leak is found, but this time from the roof, so they call in some professional climbers to scale their bell tower to find the source of the problem. With wedding season over, Tim and Margreeth launch a foodie weekend. With a professional chef hired to produce the food and some trainee butlers on hand to serve more than 20 guests, the couple can take it easy - apart from foraging for mushrooms, dressing the dining room and fixing a guest's belt. Meanwhile, May and her son Jack get the yoga room ready for the imminent arrival of guests.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud reviews the progress of Denise Daniel and Doug Ibbs, who set out three years previously to turn a dilapidated 18th-century manor house in the remote Creuse region of central France into a B&B. At the time, he was concerned to find they did not speak the language, planned to do most of the work themselves and only had enough money to survive for a year

programme.title: Astrid: Murder in Paris
programme.desc: A young woman is found dead in a forest, with her body partially scorched having not long given birth. The baby is nowhere to be found and there is evidence of strange rituals at the scene of the crime. The team suspects witchcraft is at play. Sara Mortensen stars. In French with English subtitles

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old man arrives in hospital after collapsing in the street whilst walking his dog, and doctors give him medication to try and stabilise his very high heart rate. Meanwhile, a young boy is treated after pushing a plastic toy down his ear, and doctors show concern for a man who has numbness in his arm and little finger, and send him for a CT scan

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts, as Roisin Conaty and Asim Chaudhry take on Jon Richardson and Josh Widdicombe. Bill Bailey is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Meanwhile, a young boy is treated after pushing a plastic toy down his ear, and doctors show concern for a man who has numbness in his arm and little finger, and send him for a CT scan

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Amanda Byram learns if there's anything Scottish at all about scotch eggs, and Matt Tebbutt heads for Argentina to find out what the red liquid in a supermarket steak is if not blood. Kate Quilton reports on the dangers of feeding honey to young children

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt reports from Argentina on the price of sunflower seeds. Amanda Byram is in Yorkshire's rhubarb triangle, where she investigates how forced rhubarb can grow in complete darkness. Plus, Andi Oliver reveals how much added sugar goes into takeaway milkshakes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: House-hunters Charlotte and Ben are looking to move their young family lock, stock and barrel to the Central American country of Costa Rica. With their £200,000 budget, Ben Hillman shows them five family homes. However, it's a huge life-changing decision, so will any of them be the right fit for the adventurous pair?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Richard has dreamed of owning a tropical holiday home for more than 20 years, and thinks Nosara in Costa Rica is the perfect place. He's brought best his friend Emma along for support, and with a budget of £275,000 and five options lined up by property expert Danni Menzies, hopes to find his dream place

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Steve and Sandra met while serving in the Royal Navy, and now that Steve is on the verge of retirement they're looking for a Spanish bolthole to 'wind down' in. They love the area around Casares, so Jasmine Harman is on hand to show them five available properties within their £100,000 budget

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Catching up with two house-hunters with different needs - Indu and Jason, who in 2018 wanted to find a family home with potential in Guildford, and fashion designer Shane, who was keen to leave the bustle of the city and make a new life on the north Kent coast way back in 2003. Now Phil Spencer returns to find out if the homes that he and Kirstie Allsopp found have reaped rewards

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Catching up with two sets of house-hunters who battled the property markets either side of the Thames. In 2018, Emily and Dustin had saved a healthy deposit, but in the north London market, they were finding it hard to secure their first home. In 2009, it was all about location for Sarah and Ian. Fixated on their beloved Balham, but without the budget for two bedrooms, Phil Spencer had to employ some creative thinking in order to fulfil their wish list. Now he returns to find out how they have got on since cameras stopped rolling

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ptol Slattery hosts the first dinner party in Winchester, Hampshire, but his menu of seared scallops, lamb steak with baby new potatoes followed by chocolate mousse leaves his guests - waitress Patrician Pearson, DJ Francis Leigh, care-home worker Georgia Groves and estate agent William Tilsley - underwhelmed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Francis Leigh hosts the next dinner party in Winchester, hoping to dazzle his guests with his sunburnt chicken curry, a Thai meal with a twist and a dessert simply called 'sticky.' The entertainment for the night proves to be weird and wonderful as he dons a tutu and fur coat to serve the main course

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Waitress Patricia Pearson hosts the next party in Winchester, but the decision to write her menu in Spanish causes confusion for one guest who mistakes lamb for llama. The Peruvian-themed feast is followed by a rendition of the country's national anthem and a traditional dance involving a candle and a donkey's jaw

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the fourth night of the competition in Winchester, Georgia Groves plans a black-tie evening complete with a red carpet, posh frocks and a spray-tan booth. It appears to be going well until Patricia Pearson reveals what she thinks of Ptol Slattery and his wine antics

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent William Tilsley throws one last dinner party as a week of competitions in Winchester, Hampshire, draws to a close. The host plans to offer his guests a vegetarian menu, with a blind food-tasting game providing the evening's entertainment. As the night draws to a close, one of the competitors rises above the rest to become the winner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Five Bells near Dover, where manager Shelley Parnell and her competitive mum Linda Yates hope their bargain-priced B&B will win the day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts check in to the Thomas Paine Hotel in Thetford, where an inappropriate book is found in a bedside drawer and competition turns fierce at a Home Guard training exercise

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sarah Whitehead invite their fellow hoteliers to Tenbury Wells in Worcestershire, where they open the doors of their historic pub The Rose and Crown

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lesley and Steve Hawker welcome the contestants to the Woodlands Guest House in Exmoor, but after the bad feedback of previous rounds, it seems their rivals are out for revenge

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up to find out what they have been paid. Shelley and Linda from The Five Bells want to know why their feedback for breakfast doesn't add up, while Gez from the Thomas Paine Hotel wants to find out why Shelley and Linda scored him so low. Chris and Sarah from The Rose and Crown want to question Gez, and Steve and Lesley from Woodlands Guest House try to get to the naked truth

programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Train Journeys
programme.desc: A trip aboard Scotland's high-speed Midland Pullman train, which travels through the Perthshire town of Pitlochry, and the resort of Aviemore in the Cairngorms National Park. Passengers include a couple celebrating their anniversary, a mother bidding farewell to her daughter, and a woman who shares her alopecia story

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 64-year-old man is brought to St George's in an induced coma, having been thrown from his bicycle at high speed, with his wife by his side for support. Drama student Florian, 21, tripped and hurt his foot rushing to class, and he explains how he and his family fled war in Kosovo when he was a child, and the sacrifices his father made to get his family to safety

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Stuart, who's 40, is admitted to hospital after being involved in a high-speed collision with multiple cyclists during a race, and a CT scan reveals that he is bleeding internally. Meanwhile, 83-year-old Elicia-Jean collapsed at home after experiencing dizziness, and doctors think she may have an infection

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Meanwhile, 83-year-old Elicia-Jean collapsed at home after experiencing dizziness, and doctors think she may have an infection

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits India on the trail of turmeric and finds himself at a wedding ceremony where guests are showered with the exotic spice. Kate Quilton finds out how much milk goes into a bar of chocolate, while Andi Oliver uncovers the reason why asparagus delivers some of its eaters with very pungent urine

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Architect George Clarke delves into the world of small builds, meeting people taking tiny, unpromising spaces and creating places to live, work and play, demonstrating how big dreams can be achieved in small and affordable places. In the third episode, George meets a couple crafting a magical den for their toddler with a helping hand from a grandparent, while an aircraft technician turns a jet engine's housing into a unique camper. Elsewhere in Chile, George discovers some lip-smacking designs in a winery

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: Architect Chris Dyson helps Wendy and Allan in Colchester, who are desperate to transform their horrible-looking 1960s home into something more modern. Adamant that the house needs a drastic makeover externally and a major reconfiguration internally, can Chris satisfy their high expectations while sticking to their £150,000 budget?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect helps the owners of an Edwardian family home with an unfortunate combination of wall-to-wall 1970s panelling, an indestructible cement staircase and a boxy bathroom shoved into a bay window. He also helps a couple update their Tudor cottage by knocking two rooms together to create an opulent master en suite

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Clairvoyant Yvette Tamara hosts the first dinner party in north Kent, and the night gets off to a spooky start when data analyst John Tower and working mother Yemi Christopher-Soares discover a ghost-busting machine. Meanwhile, jeweller Lisa Townend is so impressed with Yvette's abilities that she wants to return for a psychic reading

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Data analyst John Tower hosts the second dinner party in north Kent, and lets his passion for military re-enactment show when he barks orders at the table. However, not all the guests enjoy his fatty pork stew and psychedelic dessert, and two argue over dating etiquette

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Project manager Yemi Christopher-Soares hosts the third dinner party in north Kent, where she hopes the guests will enjoy her Nigerian-inspired menu and appreciate her love of all things spicy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jono Simm hosts the penultimate dinner party in north Kent and is convinced his wholesome and hearty menu is the way to win. However, two of his guests are less than impressed by his cooking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party-loving Lisa Townend hosts the final dinner party in north Kent, and hopes that a menu full of French fancies and innovative entertainment in the form of human roulette, will be enough to impress her guests and see her crowned winner of the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Vale of Berkeley Guest House in Gloucestershire, where owners Harri and Claire Chiba hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, two guests from rival B&Bs have an issue with the no-frills toilet, and another places a tricky request for 'anaemic toast' at the breakfast table

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Artist Residence in Penzance, Cornwall, where proprietors Justin and Charlie hope to impress their rivals with a pottery class. However, one pair decide their room is too modern for their tastes, a duo are shocked to find hair in a shower filter and one guest seems underwhelmed by breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host are Alec and Craig Coleman, who open the doors to the Edenfield Guest House in Blackpool and invite their fellow B&B owners to rate their establishment. However, on arrival one of the guests and his wife discover stains on the bedspread, while others feel the 'award-winning' food is not up to scratch

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the New Inn, Portland, Dorset, for the fourth day of the competition, where hosts Stacey and Spencer Cullum introduce their guests to a typical island activity - sandcastle building. Meanwhile, Claire Chiba quizzes Stacey about her breakfast hamper and says she is alienating customers, before Harri Chiba tells Justin that his B&B is too 'manufactured'

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. Two contestants attempt to explain away their negative feedback, and one contender finds herself unable to hold back her frustration, before the winner of the competition is revealed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Oil and gas co-ordinator Danielle Greenwood is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in the Merseyside area, as she welcomes divorcee Jade Chantelle Short, Michael Buble impersonator Jamie Somers, pastoral care manager Steven Booth, and nursery school teacher Anna Senior into her home. Danielle takes no risks with a down-to-earth menu, which she hopes will help bag her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pastoral care manager Steven Booth hosts the second Merseyside dinner party, and names each course after a Tina Turner song, hoping to win the £1,000 prize. The food is well received, but tensions rise when one guest makes a tactless comment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous PR representative Jade Chantelle hosts the third night in Merseyside, where she hopes a casino-themed evening with lashings of champagne and a high-class menu will help her to win the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Anna Senior hosts the fourth night in Merseyside with a fairy tale-themed evening. Her menu consists of a Mad Hatter's soup and sandwich, a special pork dish cooked three ways and baked cheesecake for dessert, but she must try to control the tension between Jamie and Jade to have a successful party

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Michael Bublé impersonator Jamie Somers hosts the final Merseyside dinner party, but may have to put aside his differences with guest Jade if he is to be crowned the winner of the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff and patients at St George's in south west London talk about the importance of family support when dealing with difficult circumstances. Fifty-one-year-old painter and decorator Gary is rushed to St George's after falling 10 feet from a ladder. Cameras also follow five-year-old Beatriz, who has symptoms of a fever. She has a rare kidney condition that affects her immune system, making her vulnerable to infection

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has injured himself while wheeling a push bike home and is in agony. The paramedics are concerned he has broken his hip. A daughter discovers her mum has died suddenly at home and calls for help. As the death is unexpected not only does the daughter have to confront her grief but she's also faced with a raft of necessary bureaucracy

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: Shaun discovers that a patient's parents are keeping the truth about his diagnosis from him. The team members race to find out what is causing a patient's severe allergic reactions

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The heli-medics race to assist Linda, who has suffered a heart attack on a Norfolk beach. Motocross rider Alex is in a bad way after being hit by another bike. Meanwhile, in Cumbria, 15-year-old cyclist Dan is treated for a possible skull fracture after colliding with a car on a country road

At the Lizard Peninsula, Rick heads out to sea to fish for red mullet, and on the wild coast at Land's End, he discovers why Cornwall has a rather unusual animal as its national emblem

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Roseland Peninsula, beginning at a spot believed by some to have been visited by Jesus Christ. He tours the bay of St Mawes with Alex and Olga Polizzi, who own one of Cornwall's most luxurious hotels, and meets one of the county's oldest butchers, who demonstrates the ancient practice of aging meat. Finally, in the harbourside village of Mousehole, Rick meets a potter who finds inspiration from the local landscape

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: The Drug Squad hunts for an illegal fuel stash hidden deep in the Rock of Gibraltar, and Customs officers find valuable intelligence in an abandoned boat

programme.title: Fast Justice

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: This comedy pair have only recently got to know each other and couldn't be more different - Darren is a former bouncer and self-confessed city boy with an obsession for social media, and Ria is full of adventurous spirit with a PhD and autism. She's persuaded him to go rogue and hit South Africa, and it's 1.2 million square kilometres of wilderness just waiting to be explored. They begin their 800km journey getting to know each other better in Cape Town before heading inland and off-road, tackling ancient valleys, jagged mountains and vast plains seeking out adventure on their way to the tip of the continent. This whirlwind trip into nature and the unknown helps them both face things in life they find a challenge

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines the social significance of cars in the 20th century. He begins by travelling to Germany, Italy and Russia to examine how dictators kick-started the mobilization of the masses, finding tales of design brilliance, abject failure, war, fraud and double dealing. James also learns about how the British motor industry blew a gift-wrapped chance to rule the world and he gets his own back with a stunt that means bad news for one of the planet's most hated cars

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter continues his examination of how the car became an everyday part of people's lives, exploring the weird world of small vehicles. He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Comedians Ed Byrne and Andy Parsons drive along Siberia's M56 Kolyma highway, known as the 'Road of Bones'. Along the way, they brave sub-zero temperatures, traverse icy routes, encounter deserted gulags and meet the locals who inhabit the frozen wilderness, but despite picking up practical tips for survival, the duo feel they are out of their depth

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Broadcasters Sue Perkins and Liza Tarbuck drive along the Ho Chi Minh Trail, a network of roads and paths in Southeast Asia that was littered with unexploded bombs following the Vietnam War. Their journey takes them through jungles and mountains to some of the least-explored corners of Laos and Vietnam, and proves to be a gruelling test of their bravery, motoring skills and senses of humour

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Frank announces his engagement, but Lee cannot believe that any woman would want to marry his father so Lucy invites Frank and his beau Carol to dinner to allay Lee's misgivings. When Carol turns out to be perfect, Lee becomes even more nervous fearing that if she dumps his dad, it'll be his shoulder that he will cry on. In an effort to determine Carol's motivations, Lee joins Frank's dating app and puts himself forward as a potential date for her. If she bites, he will know she's up to no good. programme.title: James May's Cars of the People

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. The route has numerous river crossings and the duo face a variety of broken bridges and flimsy ferries as the only way across, while the roads themselves are mired with thick mud. programme.desc: How the rise of train travel between cities led engineers to consider how to travel within them - leading to the development of the London Underground

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Built in 1934, Ordensburg Vogelsang, a virtual Nazi Castle was constructed with the intention of building the New German; elite future leaders of the Reich

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The steeplejack's interest in industrial engineering, which was sparked by the building of canals, railways and bridges near his Bolton home. The documentary visits Hadrian's Wall, the canal tunnels in Dudley and Conway's suspension bridge

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The steeplejack shares his appreciation for the skills of the men who built Britain's great castles, palaces and country houses. He draws on his experiences as an apprentice joiner to offer demonstrations of building techniques, including the humorous falling-down arch

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Newhaven to Worthing, examining the nation's hidden defences, and taking in two magnificent engineering achievements - the Ouse Valley Viaduct and the Clayton Tunnel. High on top of a favourite Victorian beauty spot he learns how trains carried hordes of day-trippers to fly kites, and finds a novel way to pick tomatoes in Worthing

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Littlehampton, where he discovers how Victorian engineers defended the town's residents from cholera. He stops off at Gosport and experiences the lethal firepower unleashed on the French during in an arms race. In the New Forest, the presenter visits Florence Nightingale's family home, before finishing at Beaulieu, where he seizes the opportunity to drive the first motor car

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Leeds, Michael Portillo sets off in Leicester, where he finds out about the hunt for Richard III's remains. Michael works his passage on the Great Central Railway from Rothley to Loughborough, where he learns about a family that has been casting bells in the town since 1839

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, Michael Portillo rediscovers a once-famous poet in Nottingham and travels on a railway line resurrected by popular demand after falling victim to Beeching's cuts. He finds out how Doncaster rail workers shaped British political history, before reaching his final destination of Leeds, where he auditions at Britain's oldest continuously working music hall

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek picks up a lovingly restored 1925 Calthorpe motorbike that he thinks is more of a work of art than anything ever produced by Picasso

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail journey along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Milwaukee, a city on the shore of Lake Michigan, where he learns about the history of the iconic American Harley Davidson motorcycle. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo makes his way from Chicago to Champaign, Illinois. programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress flies over Tokyo in a helicopter. The city was bombed extensively during the Second World War, so almost all of it is a symbol of the post-war economic boom that saw Japan become the world's second largest economy. While in the capital, Joanna heads out to a nightclub to see a Japanese girl band and witnesses the largely male audience perform almost as much as the artists on stage. Later, Joanna travels to the Kiso Valley to walk the Nakasendo Way, an ancient route that once linked Tokyo to Kyoto, a place best known for that most famous of Japanese traditions, the Geisha

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress heads to the island of Shikoku hoping to gain a better understanding of Japanese Buddhism. She then takes a bullet train to another island - Kyushu - where she finds the Henn Na Hotel, the world's first robot hotel. At Nagasaki, she visits Shiroyama Elementary school, one of the only buildings to survive the atomic bomb dropped on the city in 1945. Joanna then travels to Sakurajima, one of the country's most active volcanoes, before heading to the islands of Okinawa where one of the bloodiest battles of the Second World War was fought

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress embarks on her third travelogue, having previously traced the Nile from its source and sampled the varied rural, historical and urban cultures of Greece. This time, she sets out to travel 6,400 miles making use of the Trans-Siberian Railway, which is considered the longest railway line in the world. Joanna's journey begins in Hong Kong, where she spent some of her childhood. She takes a bullet train to Beijing, where she meets a woman who claims to have known the last Chinese emperor's favourite concubine, and officially joins the Trans-Siberian track. From there, she travels to the Great Wall, and takes an overnight train into Mongolia via the Gobi desert

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress reaches the midway point of her 6,000-mile journey from Hong Kong to Moscow via the Trans-Siberian Railway, taking in the varied sights of Mongolia. She spends time with native nomads, and visits a giant statue of Genghis Khan, as well as a gold mine. She also heads to the nation's capital, Ulan Bator, where she tracks down the famous Mongolian throat-singers, before catching a train bound for Russia. However, making a start on the Siberian leg of her trek proves more difficult than Joanna expects when she experiences a spot of bother at the border
