programme.desc: Claudia and Robin feel the pressure as the buyer from Vietnam arrives to inspect their jade. And, Scrappy Larry's fiancé wants to improve his diet

programme.title: Jade Fever
programme.desc: Robin and the crew are under massive pressure to cut a big slab of jade before the buyer leaves. Will their painstaking work finally be rewarded?

programme.title: Expedition Mungo

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: Henry Cole climbs aboard the brand new Norton Domiracer to take on the A-roads of East Anglia, where he grew up. Domiracer is eager to eat up the miles, but Henry wants to stop at some of the places he used to go as a youngster

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Wendy Tinnion helms the final event in Cumbria and decides to throw a Friday night disco for her fellow diners. However, her guests are in for a shock when they discover something unexpected about their host

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, three rival couples compete to host the best dinner party and win £1,000. Ultra-competitive accountants Omer and Adeeba serve up an experimental Asian menu. Sustainable food growers Bobby and Alison, who live in a yurt in the grounds of a grand stately home, dish out homegrown, organic food under the stars. On the final night, Liz and Stuart host, and Stuart realises that it might be an uphill battle to impress their rivals. None of their guests is aware that Stuart and Liz don't actually live together, but questions are raised when Adeeba and Alison don't find any of Stuart's clothes in the master bedroom, and Omer and Bobby discover Stuart's campervan with a double bed parked outside

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: TV presenter Kim Woodburn and her husband Pete decide they would like to take ownership of a holiday home on the Costa del Sol, so Jonnie Irwin takes them to view five penthouses that meet their £320,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: With retirement rapidly approaching, Jan and Phil Jackson wish to relocate to the Canary Island of Fuerteventura, having been inspired by Jan's sister who has already made the move there. Property expert Scarlette Douglas shows them five detached villas within their £215,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Portugal, a B&B gets busy after Covid restrictions ease, a family house-hunts in Italy and a couple in France race to finish renovating their holiday lets. Meanwhile, an ambitious trio hope to start a gin distillery in Spain, but get tied up in red tape

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: On the Isle of Wight, Henry Cole finds an unusual three-wheeled motorbike and Simon O'Brien unearths an old projector screen that he wants to turn into a work of art

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In north Surrey, planning enforcement officer Becky is joined by singing teacher Petrina, drum teacher Rob, solicitor Shoba and building company boss Giovanni. Becky plans to delight her guests with an evening of modern home-cooking and a menu including butternut, lamb and a deconstructed apple dessert. The week gets off to an intriguing start with young gun Rob taking a shine to Petrina and vice versa

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Solicitor Shoba hosts the second night in north Surrey, and tries to impress with an Indian-themed menu. However, the guests are less than impressed with the food, especially the main course - a curry made from frozen fish - but will a bit of belly dancing, Bollywood-style, help save the day? Meanwhile, singer Petrina and drummer Rob continue their flirting both at and away from the table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Drum tutor Rob hosts the third night in north Surrey, hoping his Thai-themed menu will impress his guests, as well as the object of his affections, Petrina. He serves prawns with lemon, lime and chilli for his starter, Thai chicken curry for his main, and rounds off with his own take on an ice-cream sundae. As a single man living in his stepmother's house, Rob thinks his competitors will see him as an underdog, so is intent on pulling out all the stops

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Singing teacher Petrina hosts the fourth dinner party in north Surrey, and she believes her experience of entertaining on cruise ships will give her the edge as she plans a showstopper of an evening. However, the diners seem more interested in their host's continued flirting with fellow guest Rob. Will tonight be the night, or will he shy away when he discovers Petrina has sung in the West End and worked with dozens of household names?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Giovanni hosts the final night of the competition in north Surrey, intent on flying the flag for Sicily with some family inspired recipes. Even with help from his father, a tagliatelle tragedy leaves him with Parmesan on his face. Becky is less than impressed with Giovanni's dishes, and matters go from bad to worse when he attempts to serve his home-made pasta. However, poor food doesn't deter a romantic Rob from popping the question to Petrina, sending shockwaves across the dining room. In a final attempt to bag the £1,000, Giovanni invites an opera singer to liven up the proceedings, but his musical initiative may prove too little to save the day

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Joe and Kirsty fell in love after meeting at work three years ago. Now they want to swap their house in Hampshire for their perfect home in the warmer climes of inland Valencia, Spain. With a maximum budget of £280,000, the pair look to property expert Jean Johansson to help them realise their dream

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Liverpool pair Jeanette and Ian have dreamed for years about owning a holiday home by Spain's popular Mar Menor, and with retirement approaching they feel it's the right time to make that dream come true. Scarlette Douglas impresses them with five properties to choose between within their budget of £75,000

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The host takes on a classic 1930s terraced home with a kitchen that's so tiny the fridge and oven have to live in another room. The two mismatched fireplaces are causing marital strife, with one of the couple loving the original 1930s one, and the other favouring the Victorian reproduction. Only one fireplace can stay in George's new art deco-inspired scheme. Plus, he revisits a Victorian home where George previously helped renovate the bottom two floors

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A delivery driver is the victim of a carjacking and ends up being dragged along the road. On the M40, 13 stowaway migrants are found in a lorry full of tyres and in need of urgent medical care. A man collapses while having a fit in the middle of a busy road, and a woman experiences uncontrollable spasms in her legs at the stress of losing a child

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 69-year-old man is rushed to St George's after collapsing on a tennis court, and the resus team has to work quickly to get his dangerously high heart rate under control. Other patients include a father suffering from shortness of breath and a young man who sustained a head injury playing football. Newly qualified consultant Mehrad recounts what it's like to work under pressure and the satisfaction of saving a patient's life

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies is on Spain's Costa Del Sol, which as one of Europe's top golfing destinations is popularly known as the Costa De Golf. House hunter Peggy is a massive fan of the game and can't think of anywhere else she'd rather buy a holiday home, so she's counting on Danni to find her the perfect property. For her £115,000 budget, Danni tees up five options for Peggy to see along with her mother Coral, but will any score a hole in one?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Guildford, Surrey, the first host is glamorous 22-year-old cosmetic-surgery-fan Shanice, who hopes to show she is more than just a pretty face by serving up sumptuous food and dazzling conversation. The guests she must impress are 32-year-old entertainer David, 69-year-old Norwegian plain-talker Vivi, 47-year-old super-competitive Neil and 25-year-old media sales worker Charlotte. With risky menu choices and a fellow diner's peculiar laughter taking the spotlight, will the conversations ranging from lookalikes to riding polar bears be enough to secure Shanice the prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired estate agent Vivi hosts the second dinner party in and around Guildford. She is convinced her experience and original Scandinavian fayre can beat her less experienced competition and the soiree features Norwegian fish soup, ghost stories, ghost impressions, Norwegian singing and nursery rhymes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sales manager Charlotte hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in and around Guildford, hoping to impress her guests enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, she has taken a huge risk with an Asian-inspired menu, which could prove to be too exotic for entertainments manager David

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The penultimate day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sees children's entertainments manager David playing host. Having worked in the entertainments industry all his life, he is no stranger to showing people a good time, and employs his colleagues to put on a performance, while keeping his food simple. Is he forgetting the key ingredients of a dinner party?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sales director Neil devises a sophisticated menu, dismissing his predecessors' efforts as unambitious. However, his unusual fayre is tempered by his choice of yodelling entertainment, which threatens to hinder his chance of scooping the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple buy a B&B in Portugal at the height of the Covid lockdown, a family renovate a Norfolk cottage to fund a move to Italy, and there's a new glampsite in the making in France

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple await permission for their glampsite in France, a new B&B opens in Portugal and a Norfolk family leave the UK for Italy - but their journey is far from plain sailing

programme.desc: With a budget of £70,000 Ben Hillman delivers five properties on Spain's popular southern Costa Blanca for Jacqui Tanner to find her dream holiday home to share with husband Adrian

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Croydon-based Clement and Tracy-Anne want to escape south London's dull weather for the sunshine and glamour of Marbella in southern Spain. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Marian and Donald seek a two-bed, two-bathroom property with a sea view in Almuñécar on Spain's Costa Tropical. Jasmine Harman jets off to help the pair by finding five options for them to choose between

programme.title: Billionaire Blooms
programme.desc: Cameras delve behind the scenes to observe the work of some of the UK's top florists as they create floral wonderlands for their super-wealthy clients. In this first episode, Jamie is in Italy for his toughest gig yet, the wedding of one of his most treasured clients. A multi-venue event spans four days and the length and breadth of Venice. Jamie needs to transport himself, his team of almost 40 and over 100,000 stems of the best flowers available everywhere by boat, in baking heat. Back in London, Afia tackles an outdoor wedding and has to think on her feet when construction issues threaten her design

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Architect Henning Stummel and his partner Alice Dawson plan to convert a dilapidated joinery workshop in north London into a contemporary family home and office. They want to preserve the building's original steel frame, but to restore it they will have to take it down, which means carefully extracting it from the neighbours' walls without causing damage to their property - and that's just the start of the couple's problems. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.desc: The rivals are glamping at Holly Grove Farm in Staffordshire. Hosts Dave and Karon believe it is a rural idyll and their guests agree - apart from one, who is not happy with their size of their hut

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mel and Steve want to buy a holiday home in south Queensland, Australia that will become their permanent home once they retire. It's a big challenge for Ben Hillman as he sets out to find a property that gives Mel, Steve and Vikki everything they want from their wish-list, on their budget of £220,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Ant Horsley is one of a team of officers pursuing a car suspected of being linked to the drugs trade, and a high-speed and hazardous chase ensues across the Peak District. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Columbo

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk and George Hamilton

programme.title: Columbo

Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Rip Torn, Gary Kroeger and Jamie Rose

programme.title: Columbo

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

Comedy, starring Brenock O'Connor and Jamie Foreman

Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William becomes convinced Mary is involved with Reuben, and arrives at her flat hoping to catch them red-handed - only to discover he has got it all wrong. Unable to cope with the subsequent embarrassment, he ends their relationship and considers selling his business and making a fresh start in New Zealand, but Mary hears of his plans and rushes round, shocking him with a marriage proposal. Will love finally conquer all for the off-on couple? Romantic drama, starring, Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Paterson Joseph, Cheryl Campbell and Michael Begley

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Amelia shares the news of her engagement with Arthur and Jaggers, who both warn her not to rush into things with Compeyson - but their words only make her more determined. Honoria comes to terms with letting Hawdon go, while Bucket is running out of reasons for keeping Fagin in prison

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley joins the cast of the drama about four women whose lives have all been touched by infidelity. Katie's mother has come back into her life, and is concerned about her daughter's destructive romances. Trudi's business is putting her relationship with Richard under intense pressure, Jessica pines for a baby and Siobhan's contentment with the single life comes to an abrupt end when her daughter's father reappears. Sarah Parish, Sharon Small, Shelley Conn and Orla Brady star

programme.desc: A sexually unsatisfied woman realises her husband's beloved new car means more to him than her. Comedy, starring Julie Walters, Ian Charleson and Stratford Johns

programme.title: Touched by Auschwitz
programme.desc: Feature-length documentary marking the 70th anniversary of the liberation of the concentration camp by Red Army troops. Laurence Rees travels to Jerusalem, Chicago, London, Bavaria, Krakow and Tel Aviv to talk to six survivors, along with their friends and families, who discuss the problems, challenges and triumphs they have experienced since the end of the Second World War. Among those interviewed are Tadeusz, who became a doctor but still had to fight persecution by communists in Poland, and Hermann, who went on to become a successful antiques dealer in Bavaria, but still suffers from recurring nightmares
